A tough day for Mayo - but an encouraging one for Cork. Here are the match highlights #free https://t.co/EVk9slTdEj
GOAL: Brian Hurley makes no mistake from a second Cork penalty, 1-18 to 0-7. No way back for Mayo now
52 mins: Cork 0-17 Mayo 0-5 Attendance confirmed at 4649
44 mins: Cork 0-16 Mayo 0-4. Rob Hennelly has just saved a penalty from Daniel Goulding but Mayo have still yet to score in the second half
@Rackob @BHDFlanagan we're the new Laois ðŸ˜„
Hat: Cork 0-12 Mayo 0-4. Mayo will have the wind at their backs in the second half
30 mins: Cork 0-10 Mayo 0-3. Mayo have called for reinforcements early - Aidan O'Shea on for Kevin McLoughlin. Plenty of niggle in the game
20 mins: Cork 0-5 Mayo 0-2 #Allianzleagues #Div1
Mayo make 2 changes ahead of Div 1 clash v Cork: Colm Boyle & Conor O'Shea start, Shane McHale & Aidan O'Shea out https://t.co/HdK5ADsnJV

Shocked & saddened to hear about the passing of John Corcoran - a real Cork GAA character.A Rebel to the core & rarely without a smile. RIP

That last defeat for Dublin was actually March 1st in the league v Kerry. Longford last won the O'Byrne Cup in 2000.
@brenmurph @Copenred @ChrisBMcManus @Kennypmorg not feeling well, might have to skip school tomorrow
FT:Longford 1-12 Dublin 0-9.Ld deserving winners.No wild celebrating at final whistle.Dubs first loss since last Feb https://t.co/Nl3H3FgUc5
GOAL: Liam Connerton, son of boss Denis, pounces on a loose ball. Longford 1-11 Dublin 0-8 after 64 mins
Dubs miss a free to go level and Longford have just added two points to go three ahead. 0-11 to 0-8 with 62 mins gone
55 mins: Longford 0-9 Dublin 0-8. Longford still lead but look like they are starting to tire a little
HT: Longford 0-7 Dublin 0-4. Super long range free from Robbie Smyth gives Ld 3pt interval lead. Decent crowd here https://t.co/pIZPgEI700
19 mins: Longford 0-4 Dublin 0-3. Plenty of bite in the game, some big hits going in - ref allowing a lot go #obyrnecup
Stephen Cluxton will start his first game of 2016 v Longford today. Hill 16 army trickling in https://t.co/3iszTXotgH
Well played https://t.co/xYnybY5FNw

FT: Kilkenny 0-21 Galway 1-14. The Cats hold on after Galway had rallied in the last quarter of the game.
67 mins: Kilkenny 0-19 Galway 1-14
GOAL for Galway - Paul Hoban. Kilkenny reply with a point immediately. 57 mins: Kilkenny 0-17 Galway 1-11
45 mins: Kilkenny 0-15 Galway 0-7. Kilkenny have had two goal chances as well - one missed, the other well saved
HT: Kilkenny 0-13 Galway 0-5. Galway, for whatever reason, seem to lack energy. Nothing sticking in their full-forward line. Att: 7402
30 mins: Kilkenny 0-13 Galway 0-4. TJ Reid with 0-10 now for the Cats
